project.name: Survival Chronicles
project.description: From podcast to page: survival, guilt and hope in a fallen world.

creator.name: Sam
creator.biography:
I am the creator of Survival Chronicles, a project born from a narrative process that began as a podcast, where the universe and characters of this story first started to take shape.

The graphic novel is a natural evolution of that narrative — a more intimate and visual way to explore themes such as memory, guilt, and survival in extreme circumstances.

The project combines writing and black-and-white graphic storytelling, with a direct and handcrafted approach.

This campaign makes it possible to take the next step: transforming that story into a complete and tangible work.

texte: SURVIVAL CHRONICLES
A graphic novel about guilt, memory, and the weight of staying alive.

This is not a story about heroes.
It is the story of someone who simply survived.

Survival Chronicles began as a podcast, where this narrative universe first started to take shape. What began as an audio story now evolves into a black-and-white graphic novel, bringing the world into a more intimate and visual dimension.

In a devastated world, with no clear rules and no easy redemption, a man writes.
Not to be remembered.
Not to justify himself.

He writes to avoid disappearing.
To avoid becoming one of those nameless bodies that dissolve into dust.

The book is drawn in traditional ink, with a raw and direct style. Each page blends introspective narration with scenes from a collapsed world, where violence is not epic, but heavy. Uncomfortable. Human.
The story does not glorify survival — it questions it.

What does it mean to stay alive when nothing remains?
What weighs more: fear… or guilt?
THE TEAM

Script and Concept: Sam
Illustration: Gemma Vegas
The script emerges from handwritten diaries and personal reflections that gave birth to the podcast. The graphic novel expands that universe and transforms it into a visual narrative.
Gemma Vegas translates that inner voice into the language of drawing: black and white, traditional ink, strong contrasts that reinforce the emotional weight of each scene.
WHAT IS THIS PROJECT?

– A printed physical graphic novel
– Black and white, traditional ink style
– First edition, signed and numbered
– Approximately 60 pages
Each copy will be carefully produced as a physical object meant to be preserved.
A digital edition will also be available for those who prefer that format.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
This campaign will fund:

– Completion of the full illustration process
– Editorial production and final layout
– Printing of the first edition
Crowdfunding allows this work to exist independently, without relying on traditional publishing houses — allowing it to be brought to life directly by the community that believes in it.
CURRENT STATUS

The project is currently in active development.
The first pages are already illustrated.
The full script is in its final stages.
The campaign will finance the completion and production of the book.

gone.name: Early Access – Creative Process
gone.desc:
You will gain exclusive early access to every finished page of Survival Chronicles as they are completed during production.
Includes author notes about the development of each scene and early access to the full digital edition once finished.

gone.name: Acceso anticipado – Proceso creativo
gone.desc:
Tendrás acceso anticipado exclusivo a cada página terminada de Crónicas de Supervivencia a medida que se vaya completando durante la producción.

Incluye notas del autor sobre el desarrollo de cada escena y acceso anticipado a la edición digital completa una vez finalizada.

gone.name: Digital Edition
gone.desc:
You will receive the graphic novel Survival Chronicles in high-resolution PDF or EPUB format.

Your name will be included on the acknowledgements page as a supporter.

gone.name: Edición digital
gone.desc:
Recibirás la novela gráfica Crónicas de Supervivencia en formato PDF o EPUB en alta resolución

Tu nombre aparecerá en la página de agradecimientos como colaborador.

gone.name: Novela gráfica física firmada
gone.desc:
Recibirás un ejemplar físico de Crónicas de Supervivencia en su primera edición.

Libro en blanco y negro, encuadernado en rústica, con el estilo original de la obra.

Incluye firma de los autores y tu nombre en la página de agradecimientos.

Una edición concebida como objeto físico, para conservar.

gone.name: Signed physical copy of the graphic nove
gone.desc:
You will receive a physical copy of Survival Chronicles in its first edition.

Black and white book, paperback binding, preserving the original style of the work.

Includes the authors’ signatures and your name printed on the acknowledgments page.

An edition conceived as a physical object — made to be kept.

project.name: Gas and Tin: Layer 1
project.description: A soldier descends into the dark depths to save humanity, but finds himself in a world of chaos.

creator.name: Philip Riley
creator.biography: An independent Filmmaker who loves all forms of animation. Loves to write and draw.

texte: Gas and Tin is a horror/fantasy graphic novel. A young soldier is sent to the deep depths of the world to find precious materials needed for humanity's survival. Accompanied only by a small robot, they both acquire these materials together. However, when the time comes to return home, something is amiss. No one is coming. With no choice, they must go up to the surface. Passing the layers of the depths.

A giant hole filled with layers, each layer different from the rest. Changes in climates, creatures, and some don't even make sense. They are forever changing, so you don't know what you're going to get when entering one. However, humans have harnessed this power to a degree. An elevator leading to one of the layers was constructed, making only two stops. But what happens if the elevator doesn't come down, what happens if you are left alone?

A skilled young soldier tasked with finding materials to save humanity. He has a wife waiting for him at home. Seeing her again and keeping her safe is what drives him to keep going. He fears almost nothing and was hand-picked for this mission among thousands of candidates. (concept art)
A small robot was sent with the soldier to help him on his expedition. He is equipped with maps, weapons, and information on the depths. (concept art)

Vicious Creatures that crave the hunt. They will hunt and kill anything that moves. They come in all different shapes and sizes. There are many different types of creatures in the depths; the example image above is only a fraction of what roams the land. (concept art)

Like most stories I have written/drawn out, I am inspired by films and Video Games. For this project specifically, I was inspired by works of art such as "Birdboy: The Forgotten Children" (Alberto Vázquez, Pedro Rivero), "Mad God" (Phil Tippett), "Pan's Labryinth" (Guillermo del Toro), "The Midnight Walk" (Klaus Lyngeled, Olov Redmalm), and "Reanimal" (Tarsier Studios). If you like this project, stay tuned for this story; it might just be your thing, and if you haven't checked these out yet, do yourself a favor.
Tier 1- Digital Copy
Tier 2- Sticker Pack
Tier 3- Physical Copy (signed)
Tier 4- Hand-drawn sketch (signed)

gone.name: Tier 1
gone.desc: Get it before it goes public! Get a Digital Copy of Gas and Tin before anyone else.

gone.name: Tier 2
gone.desc:
A pack of stickers featuring: Characters, Creatures, Word Art, and more. 
Each pack will come with 10 high-quality stickers.
Designs for the stickers will be posted when the book is closer to being finished.

gone.name: Tier 3
gone.desc: When Volume 1 is all done and printed. You will receive a signed physical copy of the book (signed).

gone.name: Tier 4
gone.desc: A 1/1 hand-drawn sketch of characters from Gas and Tin. It will be a random 4x6 drawing done by the artist, so you will not know what you are going to get (it will be related to Gas and Tin). It will be drawn with pencil and ink. The drawing will be signed.

project.name: Jewish Weirdo's Guide to Grief: a graphic novel
project.description: Laugh, cry, and feel affirmed in your grief journey

creator.name: Chana Gelbard
creator.biography: Jewish queer about town biking around Washington DC. Into radical inclusivity, kindness, & when my kitty sleeps with her paws curled up over her face

titre: Why I wrote Jewish Weirdo's Guide to Grief:
What do I hope this book will do for my readers?
texte: The day my mom Deborah died in 2024, someone gave me a popular book on Jewish grief. Like most resources on Jewish grief, it was normatively masculine and heteronormative. The tome included a large section on whether women’s voices were too holy to participate (yikes).
But I desperately needed a similar resource that would instruct me about Jewish grief and what was expected of me. My friends and loved ones needed one too.
Thus Jewish Weirdo’s Guide to Grief was born.

In writing my book, I took inspiration from a long line of Jewish graphic novelists and cartoonists – Stan Lee and Art Spiegelman for two notable examples. Graphic novels have a long Jewish history of helping us parse hard topics through funny or subversive pictures.
Who is this book for?
You might ask, who is a Jewish weirdo? I claim this term for everyone like me who draws from the margins toward the middle, who enjoys or is curious about inclusive Judaism.

My friends and loved ones, who wanted to be supportive during the aninut (period of time between death and burial), shiva, and beyond, needed a resource like this. They wanted to support me but didn't know what was expected of them or what to say.
Jewish or not, if you want to help someone grieve Jewishly, you’re enough of a Jewish weirdo for me.

We all feel lost and alone in times of great grief. In times such as these, Judaism has ancient scripts for us to follow. I want to show my readers how those ancient scripts, updated for my modern lens, helped me and can help them.

For one example, shiva practice instructs us to stay close to each other for the first seven days of grief. “Show up and give them silence,” an ancient Jewish precept about shiva, is one of my personal favorites.
In the midst of grief, there may simply be nothing you can say. You can sit next to the griever and look into the crater where their life used to be.

But over and over, Jewish practice has helped me feel surrounded by care in the midst of devastating grief. I hope that my book will be a light-hearted introduction to the ways Judaism helps us move toward each other in grief.
pay editor  -- $2500 lump sum
pay assistant for helping package and ship books -- $1000 lump sum
pay tech support person for help with formatting the book and social media campaign -- $2000 lump sum
total printing costs of 500 paperbacks, including shipping to me in Washington DC -- $3060
pay 7.5% tariff -- $230
total costs of packaging materials: $150
2 months' storage costs for 500 books: $440
transportation costs to get the books to bookstores: about $300
costs to ship to my California readers -- about $870
costs to ship to my overseas reader -- about $50
fees for processing/Kickstarter fees -- about $860
TOTAL costs: $9460
finish book 2025 ✅
editor finishes editing 2025 ✅
book goes to printer end of Feb 2026
500 copies received early April 2026; books go to storage
250 books to local bookstores mid-April 2026
up to another 250 books packaged and delivered late April 2026

I will ship exclusively to readers in the continental USA for this first limited-edition printing. The first 250 books will be first come, first served for shipping. The remainder go to my local DC and Baltimore comic books stores.
I will ship only to the continental USA for now. I will make one exception for my mom's best friend who lives in Asia. In the future, I would love to get my book worldwide.
Shipping costs: shipping is approximately $7 for any readers in the continental USA. But for my $100+ backers, shipping is included.
My assistant and I will handle packaging the books and shipping them from the nearby USPS. I will drive the remainder to my local comic books stores.
Happily, most of my readers are local so they can get their copies from the local comics stores.

project.name: We'reWolves: 1st Collector's Item Issue | 2nd Sun
project.description: Supernaturals with powers. A world mirroring, Rated M war for survival. Love, Hate, Betrayal, and Science...Unapologetic and Off-Script

creator.name: Randy Valentine Madison
creator.biography:
After 50 years of life navigating ADHD and finding the traditional doors of employment slammed shut, I stopped looking for a seat at someone else's table and decided to build my own. Black Heart, an imprint of Every Day is Valentine's Day Publishing, was born out of necessity and a refusal to be silenced.

I started writing because I had to. All other doors were closed, so I had to kick one open. I began with children’s books, but I moved into comics because the world needed a 'Wolf' that the gatekeepers were too soft to provide. While the sheep were following weak leaders and pulling wool over everyone's eyes with soft stories and fragile heroes, I was sharpening my teeth.

We are Wolves. We are hungry. I’m in the kitchen, let me cook. It’s time to eat. It’s time for Absolute Change.

titre: We'reWolves: 1st Collector's Item Issue | 2nd Sun | The Change is Absolute
"The door has been kicked off the hinges."
texte: The face of the Change. This isn't just a book; it's a manifesto. Issue #1: The Change is Absolute.
The "Super" has been stripped from the Hero. The "Super" has been stripped from the story.

The gatekeepers got comfortable, and the sheep took over. They’ve been pulling the wool over your eyes with stories that are baaaaaaaad. When you count all the sheep writing these "meh" stories and character swapping, it just makes you so sleepy because it all adds up to one thing: Superhero Fatigue.
The sheep aren't hungry anymore. They’re just following the herd. Even the movie industry starved us of stories that were already written.
Well, all that is about to change. We are hungry.
And since you are what you eat... we aren’t going to eat them...we’re going to chew them up and spit them out.
Who are we? We’reWolves.
This isn't an advertisement; it's a warning. The era of the "soft" hero is dead, and the beast is finally out of the cage.

Join the WolfPack. Back the Change. To all the wolves in sheep's clothing who tried to play along just to end up asking, "Howl can they do that?"...we heard your call. We don't like what they changed comic books into.
We are going to Make Comics Great, Again!
If you’re fed up with the same old shepherds and hate the direction the industry is heading, I have the answer: Change is Coming! Sooner than you think. 2026.
Who are we? We'reWolves and we're "Super."
Join the WolfPack, now!
Sometimes Silence Can Be So Loud.
The first four pages will leave you speechless...especially since they have no dialogue. They don’t need words, hype, or talk bubbles; the panels speak for themselves.
Look closer. Can you find the hidden message in the first two pages of color before the world turns black and white?

This is a world of humans and supernaturals...some born with power, some man-made, and some... other. Their world is closer to ours than you think; some people are just better at hiding than others. But remember: we all have a little monster in us, especially in the dark.
The Line-up:
Club Patron 1: Oh Yes! I needed a change in scenery!
Club Patron 2: The founder of the online retail KeyPoint owns this club.
Club Patron 3: I can't wait to get inside! This is going to be good!
Club Patron 4: It's so cloudy tonight, I hope they let us in before the rain starts!
L.J. (Latanya Jefa): I'm told they only let the right people in now. I just hope they don't have a scale at the door, LOL!
The Holdup:
Club Patron 1: What’s the hold up? I need a drink, and I gotta pee.
Club Patron 2: She really thought she was getting in looking like a boy? With her chest that flat, the bouncer’s probably checking her ID just to see if she is one.
Club Patron 3: Hush, y’all too loud, I am not with y'all.
The Bouncer: I’m sorry, pretty eyes, your name doesn’t seem to be on the list.
L.J. (to herself): {That’s the only thing they all find attractive about me...my eyes.}

L.J. (out loud): These pretty eyes can see just fine...even with you making the font size smaller. See? There’s my name right there, under your thumb: L.J. When you give me the thumbs up to go in, you’ll see it.

The "Super" doesn't just return in the action...it returns in the attitude. Step into the VIP lounge of Club Key, where the air is thick with neon and secrets. This is the moment the change becomes personal.
Meet India and Amabo (A Mama's Boy) as they cross paths for the first time.

"People don't meet by accident. Everyone who crosses our path is either a test, a lesson, or a blessing." In the world of We’reWolves, this meeting is all three. Amabo is the apex predator in every room; his charm is hypnotic, and his presence is overwhelming. But in this world, things move at a "Phantom Phase" pace...and if you don't slow down to see what's really lurking in the shadows, you’re bound to crash and feel trashed!
Amabo (to himself): {Damn, she smells good.}
Amabo: Hello gorgeous, my name is Amabo, and you are?
India: Hi, I'm India.
Amabo: Hello India, I might have to borrow you from your man.
India: Borrow? I don’t have a man for you to return me to. I’m single by choice.
India (to herself): {Although the choice wasn’t mine!}
Amabo: Well you're in good hands with me. Do you mind if I sit? Did you come here alone?
India: It depends. Where is your woman? I don’t want to be caught up in any nonsense.

Even on a Sunday night, the energy inside Club Key is electric. But beneath the "beautiful music" and the flashing lights, the real world is never far away. While the dance floor whispers about werewolves and "racist" supernatural fears, a shadow moves through the back of the room.
What's the deal with the guy in the black leather jacket? He isn't dancing, and he isn't drinking.
[At the DJ Booth]
Bottle Girl 1: Can’t believe this DJ is going so hard on a Sunday night!
Bottle Girl 2: It doesn’t matter what day it is, DJ Hook always be jammin’ like it’s the weekend.
Bottle Girl 3: We can make beautiful music together!
[On the Dance Floor]
Party Goer 1: This DJ is an absolute beast! I want to see if he changes into a werewolf tonight!
Party Goer 2: Oh God, don’t mention supernaturals, they totally freak me out!
Party Goer 3: Don’t say that, that’s racist!
[The VIP Table]
Amabo: Well I can be toxic but good guys are boring from what I hear.
India: And I don't like to be bored. Well tell me, 'A Who?' what's your name again?
Amabo: Amabo, it means, ‘A mama's boy’. They say, you should watch how a man treats his mother. And you’ll know how he’ll treat you.
India: Is that so? So I assume you treat your mother pretty good I presume.
Amabo: I did. I gave her the care she deserved. But sadly she passed.
India: Sorry to hear that.
[In the Shadows]

Mystery Man (to himself): {Hmm. Notification says that security guard, 'Tyler Coughlin,' is here tonight. As soon as Ralph finds me some concrete evidence that he’s touching kids, he’s going to need security...because I’m going to have Tyler coughing up blood.}

The music is loud, but the conversation at the VIP table just got quiet. While India tries to play it safe by asking about his "status," she has no idea that the "Mama's Boy" is already making his move. The storm is coming, and it’s not just raining outside.
Is India as "normal" as she claims? Or is Amabo sensing a secret that she hasn't even admitted to herself?
Amabo: It’s OK, she lived a fruitful life.
India: Hope the apple didn’t fall far from the tree.
Amabo: Ha! ‘Fall from the tree!’ Anyway, what about you, gorgeous, what are you drinking?
India: I’ve been drinking Martinis but I was just wrapping it up, I have work in the morning.
Amabo: But the night is young and it began raining. Why don’t you stay till the storm passes?
(India and Amabo lock eyes. India is unaware that Amabo’s hand is glowing purple near her drink, causing it to splash.)
India: So Amabo... forgive me for sounding rude, but you gotta ask these days. You never know. What were you born...Human? Supernatural? Other?
Amabo: I hate that question. The answer is quite dark... but trust me, ain't nothing 'wrong' with me. In fact, I'm greater than all those put together. What about you? I'm sensing something in you...
India: (Laughs) Who, me? Funny, I’m normal. Just had to get that off my chest. I don't like surprises.
Amabo: Well, what you see is what you get with me. Just a mama's boy.
[The Waitress Station]
Waitress 1: Look alive, girls. Don't want no one thinking you're a vampire. How many people in here do you think are vampires?
Waitress 2: Lord, I hope none. Keep them far away from me!
Waitress 3: That’s not nice...I have a vampire in my family.
Waitress 4: We all have at least one.
[A Table in the Crowd]
Club Patron (Man): What did the werewolf ask the hot sheep waitress? 'Howl do you taste?'
Club Patrons (3 Women): (Laughing)
Club Patron (Man): Funny, right? His wife was with him but she didn't get the joke.

Digital Shadows In a world obsessed with status and followers, some people prefer to stay off the grid. But just because you don't have social media doesn't mean you aren't being followed. While the charm offensive continues in the VIP, the "Storm" Amabo mentioned is getting closer than he realizes.
India: Do you always dress so well? Give me your social media handle and I’ll give you mine. I want to see what you're posting.
Amabo: I’m not on social media. I never had much luck with followers... they usually just end up blocking me.
[In the Shadows]
Mystery Man in Black Leather Jacket (seen only from behind): "Hmmm!"

While the sheep dance under the strobe lights, the real work happens in the silence of 4 Rest St. This isn't a club, and it isn't a game. Deep inside The Apex, the future is being grown in liquid tubes...and the straight jacket isn't just for show.
Some secrets are too dangerous to leave the lab.
[Page 11: Full Page Splash]

(The scene shifts to a cold, high-tech facility. RALPH is seen from the back, a silhouette against a glowing blue light. He is standing before a massive, reinforced liquid tube. Inside the bubbling fluid, a Straight Jacket floats, suspended as if waiting for a wearer.)
[Page 12: The Crucible]
(The interior of The Apex, located at 4 Rest St. A place of clinical precision and hidden horrors.)
Ralph (to himself): {Patience. Every predator needs a cage until they’re ready to be the storm.}
[The Crucible - Inside The Apex]

Ralph: Kiana, where's the rest of the WolfPack? There's a storm rolling in, the moon is full tonight, and where’s Julius? He was the last one I showed the ‘Mosqui-Tags’ to... and I know precisely how many are supposed to be in that tray. Now, the count is short.

Kiana: Slong is in his garage working on a weapon for Chrono. And you know I haven't seen ‘Vapor.’ Like ‘Mimic,’ he could be anywhere. Who knows? ‘Pup’ stayed home; he was feeling down after he went to court for child support. I'm going to call him before the change tonight, just to check on him.

Kiana (cont.): The rest of the Pack took the ‘FlyingWolf’ to Transylvania on that ‘Operation PReD’ mission. And Julius? I don’t know. One minute he was playing on his phone, the next he’s grabbing his leather jacket. I asked him where he thought he was going and he just said, 'Out!'
Ralph: Out? I should have used a ‘Mosqui-Tag’ on him. Kiana, did Levi finish mixing the serum we need for the Straight Jackets?
Kiana: We’re working as fast as we can sir, We’re only human!
Ralph: We must move faster before I’m not.

Ralph: Levi, if my calculations are correct, this serum for the ‘Straight Jackets’ will act as a power-stripping sedative. It should neutralize a vampire's abilities long enough for us to transport them to the Institution.
Levi: Understood, sir. And about Julius... I offered to go with him, but he’s off-leash, Ralph. You know he thinks he works better solo.
Ralph: But what kind of 'work' is he doing? I’m expecting Chrono to be here any minute now, after he’s done his studying.

Ralph (to himself): {The Moon Rock particles...or 'Mr.' as y'all call it. In their raw state, they’re a god-tier stimulant for wolves and vamps alike. But here in the Crucible, I’ve learned to invert them. Now, they're the only thing keeping that jacket from being torn to shreds.}
[SFX: WARP SOUND]
[The Apex - Main Level]
[SFX: WARP SOUND]

Chrono: Hello? Anyone home? (Jokingly, to himself) Hope I ain't too late... should 
I...howl?
Levi: Welcome to Apex 4 Rest, Chrono. I’m Levi. He’s expecting you; he’s in the Crucible.
Chrono: (To himself) Okay, the Crucible... am I supposed to know where that is? I have warping powers, but I don’t know where everything is at.
Levi: It’s 14 floors below us.
Chrono: Wait, what? How did he know what I was thinking? Does Levi have mind-reading powers? That’s warping cool!
Levi: And no, I don’t have mind-reading powers. I know because that’s what everyone asks. I am human...neither werewolf nor vampire.
Chrono: Well, gee, thanks Mr. Levi. Just 14 below?
Levi: Yes, Chrono. But wait...just 'Levi.' No 'Mr.' Save that old title for the Moon Rocks.
Chrono: Okay, ‘Mr.’ is warped out of my vocabulary. Nice to meet you!
[SFX: WARP SOUND]
[The Crucible - 14 Floors Below]
Wolves have the nose. Vampires have the sight. But in a city full of shadows, sometimes biology isn't enough. Ralph isn't just relying on nature anymore...he's perfecting it.
Welcome to the future of the hunt.
[The Crucible]
(A warp portal rips open in the center of the lab. CHRONO steps through, stumbling slightly as he spots a digital monitor. On the screen, a Mosqui-Tag is transmitting a high-def feed of its target.)
Chrono: Hey Ralph, the warpster is here. Oh cool, what is that?
Ralph: I just talked you up, kid. And look at these...this is the latest from the Crucible. I call them Mosqui-Tags.
Chrono: They look like... robot flies?
Ralph: Not flies, kid. Mosquitoes. Bats love mosquitoes. It's a natural snack for a predator that thinks it’s the only one hunting tonight.

Chrono: (Scratching his head) Okay, but why the tech, Ralph? I mean, at the fire, I’ve seen Julius and the pack find people who were still in the burning building even after the firefighters cleared it. You guys have keen scent-tracking in human form, and once you shift into the wolf? You could sniff out a needle in a haystack. Why use these when we already have the noses for it?

In the old days, you followed the scent. But in a world of Phantom Pace and high-speed escapes, the old ways are too slow. Ralph’s newest invention doesn't just track a target...it becomes a part of them.
Once you "accept the terms of service," there is nowhere left to run.
[The Crucible]

Ralph: (Pausing, looking at a Mosqui-Tag in his hand) Because fire doesn't run, Chrono. But these Unionist leeches are slippery. Between their Phantom Pace and their ability to hit the sky as bats, they can drop a scent trail or cross a river before you can get a second whiff.
Chrono: So, the nose isn't enough for them?

Ralph: The nose tells you where they were, Chrono. These Mosqui-Tags tell me where they are. They are highly sophisticated, noncombustible tracking devices designed to sample blood on contact. If the DNA matches a particular suspect, assuming I have a baseline...the tag is ingested.
Chrono: Ingested? Like... they eat the bug?

Ralph: Precisely. Once it's inside them, it’s a beacon. I can track that target for up to 100 miles, with a precision radius of five feet. They can run, they can fly... but with this, they can't hide.
Chrono: So I can follow someone on my smartphone, like on social media?
Ralph: (Thinking to himself, face hardening) {Which is exactly why Julius took them...}
Ralph: Precise... Location. But only after they've accepted the terms of service...

Forget everything you think you know about heroes and villains. In the Crucible, being "smart" and "civilized" is a death sentence. Ralph is issuing a challenge not just to Chrono, but to the entire genre: Stop being pathetic. Start being brutal. When the Red comes, the conversation ends.
[The Crucible]
Chrono: Wow, that’s warping awesome!
Ralph: And you’re The Warp Master. Kid, take no offense to what I’m about to say. I know you got a lot of green going on, but this ain't about you. Take yourself out of the equation.

Ralph (cont.): Everything ain’t what it seems. We live in an opposite world now. Right now? I’m Green. I’m fresh, I’m 'smart,' I’m a regular 'Professor'... and I am weak. I wouldn’t hurt a fly, Chrono. I’m as soft as they come. No fight in me. In this world, Green means Stop. It means I’m a dead man walking.
Ralph: But when that Red comes? Red means GO. Red is brutal. Red is a mindless, prehistoric beast. Red is strength you haven’t seen in forever. I’m talking about real strength.

Ralph: So forget the nursery rhymes they taught you. When you see Red, you move! Green is pathetic right now, but if you step up tonight? You might just make Green great again. You never know who’s watching. Don’t tell me you’re ready. Show me.
Chrono: (Nervously) I won’t let you down, sir! ...Hey, is Slong here?
Kiana: He's down the hall in the Scardy-Cat Garage. I mentioned your... 'situation' to him. He’s the best one to talk to about it.
Chrono: Gee thx, Key Key, I’ve been working on new send-off phrases. How do you like this one: 'Warp, Warp, and Awaaaay!'
[SFX: WARP SOUND]
Kiana: (Shaking her head) Weak! That would give me superhero fatigue!
[The Scardy-Cat Garage Door]

(Chrono warps to the door and knocks.) 

Chrono: Whoa, hold on! Before we introduce y'all to 'Slong the Mechanic,' Ralph says: 'Since this is just a Kickstarter Collector's Preview, it's not smart to give away the whole first issue for free.' So, I was told to warp y'all out of the garage, skip over the White House scene, and get you back to Club Key where the party continues... until you have the book in your hands. Tighten your grip... we’re warping back to Club Key!
Warp successful. We're back in the heart of the city under heavy rain.
Already in progress... behind closed doors.
India thinking to herself: I can’t get him out of my mind and Amabo reminds me so much of him.
Amabo: Are you OK gorgeous? I had to come in here, to see if everything is alright? A lot of bad people are in this club. They say, the Freaks come out at night!
India: Sorry to keep you waiting, I needed a min. Drinks got me feeling a little ... woosie!
India: It’s getting late, I think I should go!
Amabo: Please, don’t leave yet gorgeous. The night is young, and the party has just begun!
Amabo: Why are you looking at me like that?
India: You remind me of someone I once knew!
Amabo: He must have been incredibly handsome!
India: Indeed he was, now come here! And give mama a kiss!
India thinking to herself: Damn he smells good.
India: Whew! You’re strong! Don’t drop me!
Amabo: I got you. I will never drop you, gorgeous.
Amabo: Someone's coming! I'm going to take you somewhere more private.
India: Oh, fancy. All this for me? You shouldn't have.
Amabo: Nothing's too good for my... um...
India: In-dia. It's India.
Amabo: I know your name. I was just testing you.
Club Patron 1: Here’s the ladies room right here
Club Patron 1: I would tell them to get a room but this is a room technically. So maybe I should say, 'can you make some ... room?'
Club Patron 2: LOL Girl, be quiet, they can hear you!
[Kissing sound coming from the stall]
Club Patron 1: Y’all see that hot DJ checking me out?
Club Patron 2: Girl he wasn’t checking you out, he was eyeing me!
Club Patron 3: He wasn’t checking for either one of ‘y’all, I caught him watching me.
[At the same time all 3 say]
Club Patron 1: I got his number!
Club Patron 2: I got his number!
Club Patron 3: I got his number!
[SFX: Visual Chaos - Slurp! Slurp! Lick!
Twirl!]
Club Patron 1: I’mma see if she needs any help?
Club Patron 2: Girl be quiet, if you don’t leave them people alone!
[SFX: Visual Chaos - Smash! Bang! Boom! OMG! Bam! Pow!]
Club Patron 1: I can’t keep a man, we’ll be helping each other!
Club Patron 2: Girl hush, C’mon with your crazy self!

We're only pulling wool over the eyes of the sheep to get them close, but we ain't crying wolf... wolves don't cry. We're hungry and our stories have bite. Grandma is dead and We'reWolves. This ain't a children's book. Join the Pack.
The gatekeepers tried to lock the industry down with their watered-down stories. We’re here to break the lock. And this is just a taste of the beginning.
Back the Pack. Who is the man in the leather jacket? Where did Amabo vanish to so quick? And is India in a danger she can't imagine? The 'Super' has returned.

Pack, I was going to kick off this Kickstarter much harder than this, but I don't want to show my full wolf power and come off too alpha, scaring the sheep. I just wanted to get my foot in the door. Change is Coming. We'reWolves.

gone.desc: For those who want to support the Cause and the Change. You are officially inducted into the Pack. You will receive a Digital Alpha Thank You Note and access to all backer-only project updates. Whether you give $5 or $15, you are a Sentinel in our eyes. We are Wolves.

gone.name: Guardian Tier (Digital Edition)
gone.desc: Join the Wolfpack with the official digital release of We'reWolves: Issue 1. Receive a high-resolution PDF featuring the full 1st Collector's Item Issue. Experience the high-stakes battle on any digital device.

gone.name: Lone Wolf: The Core Issue
gone.desc:
"The Core Experience." This tier is for the reader who wants the story and nothing else. Secure your 1st Edition physical copy of We'reWolves Issue #1: The Change is Absolute. No cards, no extras—just the raw, gritty debut of a new "Super" era.

Includes:

We'reWolves Issue #1 (Physical Edition): Featuring the exclusive "1st Collector's Item" seal.

Reinforced Gemini Mailer Protection: Included at no extra cost to ensure your book arrives in pristine, collector-grade condition.

gone.name: Absolute Tier: The Physical Debut
gone.desc:
"The Change is Absolute." Secure the definitive physical debut of We'reWolves Issue #1. This 1st Edition printing features the exclusive "1st Collector's Item" seal.

Experience the 1st collector's items issue that promises to bring absolute change to a comic industry that stripped the super from superheroes and super stories. This is the return of high-stakes. The WolfPack stories are packed with epic power—including 8+ integrated Character Power Cards printed directly in this issue to track the Pack's elite abilities.

Includes:

We'reWolves Issue #1 (Physical Edition)

8+ Integrated Character Power Cards (Printed in-book)

Eligible for all unlocked physical Stretch Goals

Reinforced Gemini Mailer Protection

gone.name: THE RHYME & REASON BUNDLE
gone.desc:
Double the bite, double the change."

Rhyme:
One book to read in traffic,
and another book to keep in plastic.

Includes:

2× We’reWolves Issue #1 (Physical): Two 1st Edition physical copies featuring the "1st Collector's Item" seal.

1× Rhyme & Reason 5x7 Collector Card: The premium, oversized character card featuring Rhyme & Reason.

gone.name: Sentinel Tier: The Card Pack
gone.desc:
The definitive collection for the tactical fan. Secure the physical and digital debut of We'reWolves alongside the complete set of standard-sized collectibles.

Includes:

We'reWolves Issue 1 (Physical): 1st Edition with Collector's Item seal.

We'reWolves Issue 1 (Digital): High-res PDF.

Full Moon Card Set (Sentinel Tier): 8+ standalone 2.5 x 3.5 inch collectible trading cards (Standard Baseball Card Size).

Reinforced Gemini Mailer: To ensure your "steel" arrives in pristine condition.

items.name: 2.5 x 3.5 WOLF-CARD PACK:  Character Stat Card Set

gone.name: Sentinel Alpha: The Absolute Collection
gone.desc:
The ultimate acquisition for the serious collector. Lead the pack with the definitive physical, digital, and collectible foundations of the We'reWolves universe.

Includes:

Issue 1 (Physical) - Absolute Tier: The premium 1st edition comic.

Issue 1 (Digital) - Guardian Tier: High-res PDF for your digital library.

Full Moon Card Set - Sentinel Tier: 8+ oversized premium collectibles.

gone.name: High Clearance: The Apex Collection.
gone.desc:
The ultimate "Authorized Eyes Only" experience. Secure your place at the top of the WolfPack with a hand-signed collector’s debut and exclusive intel on the future of the series before anyone else gets to sink their teeth in.

Includes:

Hand-Signed & Numbered Issue 1: A premium 1st Edition physical copy, individually numbered and signed by Randy Valentine Madison.

The Classified Dossier (Physical): Early-access redacted intel on Issue 2. Get a first look at the "2nd Sun" project and the secret history of the character revealed in the Club Key files.

Signed Creator Portrait: An exclusive 8x10 physical portrait of Randy Valentine Madison, hand-signed.

Full Moon Card Set (Sentinel Tier): The complete collection of 8+ standard-sized (2.5 x 3.5 inch) collectible cards.

We'reWolves Issue 1 (Digital Edition): High-resolution PDF.

Elite "Steel" Protection: Shipped in a reinforced Gemini Mailer inside a secondary protective box to ensure your collection

gone.name: COUNCIL OF ALPHA: Executive Tier
gone.desc:
Join the inner circle of We'reWolves as an Executive Producer. This elite tier grants you a permanent name credit in the first edition of Issue 1 and an official, gold-sealed Certificate of Appointment.

You’ll participate in the 'WolfPack Council'—an exclusive 1-on-1 video call with creator Randy Valentine Madison to discuss series lore and production. You also receive the 'Top Secret' High Clearance Dossier containing a signed creator portrait, the full set of 8+ character collector cards, the physical first edition of Issue 1, and all digital rewards.

gone.name: LONE WOLF: The Alpha Edition (#001)
gone.desc:
"There can only be one Alpha."

Own the literal first piece of We'reWolves history. Strictly limited to one collector.

THE ALPHA BUNDLE:

Copy #001 / 001: The first physical print, hand-numbered and signed in gold ink by Randy Valentine Madison.

Executive Producer Credit: Your name on the "Thank You" page of Issue #1.

5x7 Character Card Set: All 8+ premium 5x7 high-gloss collector cards.

Top Secret Dossier: Physical bundle with gold-sealed Certificate, character files, and stickers.

THE ALPHA ACCESS:

Private 1-on-1 Session: A scheduled 30-min video call with Randy to discuss lore, plot, or a portfolio review.

"Incoming Howl" Video: A personalized video shoutout recorded just for you.

Digital Mastery: PDF of Issue #1 + all exclusive wallpapers.

project.name: LRP's Wheelchair Girl
project.description: A real-life inspirational story about a 12 year old dancing champion - in a wheelchair - from a small village in Kazakhstan.

creator.name: Lets Roll Productions
creator.biography:
Mohammad (Moh), a disability rights advocate, inventor, filmmaker, and motivational speaker, founded Rim Power (www.rimpower.org) in 2016 to promote accessibility and redefine normal for wheelchair users. Surviving the trauma of war in Afghanistan, losing his mother, and becoming paralyzed at age five, Moh’s resilience brought him to the U.S., where he began rebuilding his life.

By 2015, Moh showcased his 3D-printed wheelchair inventions to President Obama at the White House Science Fair. A year later, he graduated from Cambridge Rindge and Latin School and continued patenting adaptive tools and creating graphic novel heroes with physical challenges. Through Rim Power and beyond, Moh inspires wheelchair users globally to embrace empowerment and full societal participation.

texte: Promoting “Wheelchair Girl” Let’s Roll Production’s Newest Graphic Novel Publication.
The Journey of Empowerment

Mohammad Sayed (Moh), a disability rights advocate, inventor, and motivational speaker, disabled himself as a youngster in Afghanistan, started his mission to “redefine normal” by promoting and advocating accessibility and inclusion for wheelchair users and the disabled at large. Now through Lets Roll Productions, Moh continues this mission with powerful stories told with dynamic graphic novels and short films that inspire and empower disabled people to be heroes in their own right - everyday. If you have followed our stories up to now, you already know that LRP’s first disabled superhero, Wheelchair Man came to life in 2016 and told the story of a fragmented childhood and the rocky path to becoming a superhero. Moh is faced with the ultimate consequences of war at a very young age. His childhood is abruptly halted by the all too common violence against civilians. By confronting his physical obstacles and tremendous loss, Moh is able to gain an extraordinary ability. This power allows Moh to aid and prevent harm to those who experience similar losses due to the brutality of war. Wheelchair Man’s story resonated with over 4,000 readers across Afghanistan, Ecuador, Kazakhstan, and the United States. The story was translated into Dari and Pashto, printed, and distributed throughout these countries. Notably, the state department sponsored these trips.
Introducing “Wheelchair Girl: Let’s Rebuild Afghanistan”

“Wheelchair Girl” is the captivating story of a 12-year-old wheelchair user, once a dance champion, from Kazakhstan. Mentored by Wheelchair Man because of her extraordinary abilities, she embarks on a remarkable mission to rebuild Afghanistan after years of devastating wars to its former glory - despite the many challenges in her path. This graphic novel not only tells her inspiring story but also highlights the strength, resilience, and potential of individuals with disabilities to overcome seemingly impossible odds to achieve their dreams and help others to do the same.
Why This Graphic Novel Matters?
Building on the success of “Wheelchair Man,” which inspired disability awareness initiatives in Afghanistan, “Wheelchair Girl” aims to:
o Promote Disability Awareness: Showcase the capabilities and achievements of wheelchair users, or any disabled individual who never lets their disability stand in their way.

o Empower Young Readers: Inspire children with and without disabilities through relatable, heroic characters that they can aspire to, fostering a sense of confidence, resilience, and the belief that they too can achieve greatness.
o Foster Inclusion: Support global conversations about accessibility and diversity.
Support Our Mission:
We are launching a Kickstarter campaign to fund the publication and distribution of “Wheelchair Girl."
o Printing Costs: $3,000 for 600 units
o Shipping Costs: $1,200 for 600 units
o Merchandise: $5,800 for t-shirts, hats, and stickers to promote the novel.
This is the first phase of our campaign. In phase two, we aim to produce two short films to scale our message.
Join Us

Your support will help us share “Wheelchair Girl” with the world, inspire countless individuals, and continue our mission to create an accessible, inclusive society. Together, we can redefine normal and rebuild hope.
Wheelchair Man: Hope Is On The Way - Afghanistan
Wheelchair Man Ecuador Trip:

gone.name: Wheelchair Girl Hard Copy
gone.desc: Get your hands on our exclusive sticker featuring the Wheelchair Girl logo. Perfect for personalizing laptops, water bottles, notebooks, and more. Vibrant colors and durable material ensure it stands out wherever you stick it. Show off your fandom and add a splash of creativity to your everyday items.

gone.name: Wheelchair Man
gone.desc: Wheelchair Man is the story of a fragmented childhood and the rocky path to becoming a superhero. Moh is faced with the ultimate consequences of war at a very young age. His childhood is abruptly halted by the all-too-common violence against civilians. By confronting his physical obstacles and tremendous loss, Moh is able to gain an extraordinary ability. This power allows Moh to aid and prevent harm to those who experience similar losses due to the brutality of war.

gone.name: Captain Afghanistan Hard Copy
gone.desc: Captain Afghanistan, based on the real-life story of Moh’s best friend, recounts his harrowing journey after losing an eye and a leg in a landmine explosion. Wheelchair Man, driven by a mission to end all old wars and rebuild countries ravaged by conflict, is assembling a special leadership team of four, with Captain Afghanistan being the first recruit to join the team to lead and accomplish this mission.

gone.name: The Complete Package
gone.desc: The Complete Package, a hardcover graphic novel collection, includes Wheelchair Girl, Wheelchair Man, and Captain Afghanistan, all priced at just $50.

gone.name: Collector's Deluxe Edition
gone.desc:
Step into the exclusive world of Wheelchair Girl with the Collector's Deluxe Edition. This premium package includes hardcover copies of Wheelchair Girl, Wheelchair Man, and Captain Afghanistan, plus a limited edition numbered art print and personalized thank-you note from creator Mohammad Sayed (Moh).

Your name will also appear in the Special Thanks section of the graphic novel as a valued supporter who helped bring this inspiring story to life.

gone.name: Ambassador of Hope
gone.desc: Become an Ambassador of Hope and join Moh's mission to inspire and empower through storytelling. This special tier includes everything from the Collector's Deluxe Edition, plus an exclusive virtual meet-and-greet with Moh, behind-the-scenes digital booklet about the making of Wheelchair Girl, and two graphic novels donated in your name to a school or disability organization.
